title: Teamwork: past and present
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Management - Study and teaching
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Work ethic
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Labor - History
description: This first cell-animated film produced by the NFB traces the development of the master/worker relationships through successive eras of history. Stone engravings record a complete absence of cooperation between the Egyptian ruler and his slaves but, beginning with the Greeks and Romans, there was a gradual change towards recognition of the labourer. With the growth of factories, the trend received a setback, but reasserted itself through the expediencies of World War II, which saw the formation of the first Labour Management Production Committee (LMPC) in Britain. In post-war Canada the film shows LMPCs well implanted in industrial life, with the Industrial Production Cooperation Board giving official government recognition. Animation by Colin Low.
